measured_by: Random-Dot Motion Kinematogram (RDK) task with manipulated motion & color coherence
justification: In the Stimuli section the authors state: "We exposed participants to a perceptual decision-making task in which they had to identify the majority motion direction or majority color of dots in a random-dot-motion kinematograms (RDK)… We chose this task as coherence decreases typically affect humans' performance in the task, leading to increased error rates and thus increasing the difficulty of the task."

measured_by: Accuracy on subsequent hard test trials
justification: Under Testing the paper notes: "Figure 4 depicts the accuracy of human participants in the test trials. We observed that participants were significantly more accurate during testing if they were previously exposed to an ascending curriculum…" demonstrating that curriculum effects were assessed via accuracy on these hard test trials.
